TextBlock.Text: IDAEA: Station Log 215.
IDAEA: I'm too tired to write. I'm just going to record this one.
IDAEA: The station failed. We've checked over and over again for equipment failure, but it seems that the mistake happened before we laid even the first scaffold.
IDAEA: We built the station on rotten foundations. The fundamental science just doesn't scale up as we predicted. It's almost laughable.
IDAEA: Here I sit, staring into the face of this beautiful star, from a distance of mere meters, and still I'm not so blinded as this project's planners were.
IDAEA: Blinded by the prospect of discovery. Blinded by the promise of catharsis. Blissfully ignorant of ethics and responsibility.
IDAEA: And now, in our haste to lunge forward into uncertainty, we have built a hulking, useless monument to that failure.
IDAEA: This station will serve as a constant reminder that we ran too far, too fast, and thought ourselves so infallible that we didn't watch where we were going.
IDAEA: The very light that illuminates our way will be marred by the flicker of its shadow.
IDAEA: I should be happy.
IDAEA: The project has been placed on indefinite hiatus. The sun is safe from our meddling. We, in turn, are no longer at risk of causing our own extinction.
IDAEA: Everything I could have asked for at the start of the project has come to pass. I ought to be celebrating.
IDAEA: Instead, I can only think of how devastated Fuchsia would be.
IDAEA: Of how devastated Pye is.
IDAEA: When we realised what happened, she-
IDAEA: She sounded just like her.

IDAEA: Despite my reservations, I know that Fuchsia would have leapt at this project. I can imagine her dancing down the hallway to the viewing platform. Humming as she calculates the energy transfer.
IDAEA: I've been clinging to a ghost, trying to swallow my morals for the approval of someone long since gone.
IDAEA: I haven't been approaching the work as myself. But I can't channel her, either.
IDAEA: She was a unique and beautiful star. And I, in comparison, have allowed rot into my foundations.
IDAEA: I've been torturing myself for so long. I'm exhausted. Yarrow is right, I should rest.
IDAEA: Then I can come back with a clear head, and rather than fighting with Pye, maybe... Maybe we could be friends.

IDAEA: Perhaps, once I let go of the past, I'll be able to understand her view of the future. Or maybe I'll convince her to stop chasing it. In the meantime, I know exactly what I want to do right now.
IDAEA: I'm going home. Mitis will hold me and I'll remind him how much I adore him. Then I'll scoop up Ilex and hug him tight.
IDAEA: And I'll spend the night with the two people I love most in the world.
